subject: Sexual Health
title: Sex Starts in the Brain
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sex Starts in the Brain usable.

hook.text: The most important sexual organ in the human body is not below the waist. It is the brain.

buildup.text: Every aspect of sexual experience, from desire to pleasure to bonding, originates in brain circuits.

discovery.text: The hypothalamus, amygdala, and prefrontal cortex all play distinct roles in the sexual response cycle.

twist.text: People with spinal cord injuries can sometimes experience orgasm through brain stimulation alone, proving it leads.

climax.text: Understanding the brain's role in sexuality transforms how we approach desire, dysfunction, and pleasure.

punchline.text: The brain is the real sexual organ. Everything else follows.

quiz.question: Which organ controls all aspects of sexual experience?
